intro: Bromus confertus var. nanus, commonly known as the dwarf brome, is a small annual grass species native to the western United States. It typically grows in open, disturbed sites such as roadsides, fields, and dry meadows. The plant has slender,丛生 (tufted) growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and narrow, linear leaves with a prominent midrib. It is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions.
